item.title: Mary add a quote by Mary Ann Shaffer
item.description: "Reading good books ruins you for enjoying bad books." -- Mary Ann Shaffer

item.title: Mary add a quote by Norton Juster
item.description: "People laughed less and grumbled more, sang less and shouted more, and the sounds they made grew louder and uglier. It became difficult to hear even the birds or the breeze, and soon everyone stopped listening for them." -- Norton Juster

item.title: Mary add a quote by Laura Ingalls Wilder
item.description: "The real things haven't changed. It is still best to be honest and truthful; to make the most of what we have; to be happy with simple pleasures; and have courage when things go wrong." -- Laura Ingalls Wilder

item.title: Mary add a quote by Agatha Christie
item.description: "I dare say it is good for one now and again to realize what an idiot one can be! But no one relishes the process." -- Agatha Christie
